summary: This document is an email chain from October 9, 2020, discussing the forensic imaging of three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case. The emails are between FBI forensic examiners and a CART coordinator, coordinating the transfer of the drives to the SDNY (Southern District of New York) and emphasizing the need for efficiency due to the case's high-profile nature.

persons.name: Frank
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the coordination of forensic hard drive imaging for the Epstein case. The email sender notes 'Good talking to you today Frank.'

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Hard Drive Imaging
events.description: FBI forensic examiners coordinate the receipt and imaging of three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case, with plans to transfer them to the SDNY.

keyFacts: Three 2TB external hard drives related to the Epstein case were being forensically imaged by the FBI on October 9, 2020.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) requested that each device's extracted files be placed in its own folder.
The email chain emphasizes the need to avoid delays due to the high-profile nature and attention the case was receiving.
One examiner mentioned being 'OCONUS' (outside the continental United States) the following week on this case.
